28/*
29 * Functions to convert between a list of vdevs and an nvlist representing the
30 * configuration. Each entry in the list can be one of:
31 *
32 * Device vdevs
33 * disk=(path=..., devid=...)
34 * file=(path=...)
35 *
36 * Group vdevs
37 * raidz[1|2]=(...)
38 * mirror=(...)
39 *
40 * Hot spares
41 *
42 * While the underlying implementation supports it, group vdevs cannot contain
43 * other group vdevs. All userland verification of devices is contained within
44 * this file. If successful, the nvlist returned can be passed directly to the
45 * kernel; we've done as much verification as possible in userland.
46 *
47 * Hot spares are a special case, and passed down as an array of disk vdevs, at
48 * the same level as the root of the vdev tree.
49 *
50 * The only function exported by this file is 'make_root_vdev'. The
51 * function performs several passes:
52 *
53 * 1. Construct the vdev specification. Performs syntax validation and
54 * makes sure each device is valid.
55 * 2. Check for devices in use. Using libdiskmgt, makes sure that no
56 * devices are also in use. Some can be overridden using the 'force'
57 * flag, others cannot.
58 * 3. Check for replication errors if the 'force' flag is not specified.
59 * validates that the replication level is consistent across the
60 * entire pool.
61 * 4. Call libzfs to label any whole disks with an EFI label.
62 */
63
64#include <assert.h>
65#include <devid.h>
66#include <errno.h>
67#include <fcntl.h>
68#include <libintl.h>
69#include <libnvpair.h>
70#include <limits.h>
71#include <stdio.h>
72#include <string.h>
73#include <unistd.h>
74#include <paths.h>
75#include <sys/stat.h>
76#include <sys/disk.h>
77#include <sys/mntent.h>
78#ifdef __FreeBSD__
79#include <libgeom.h>
80#endif
81#ifdef __NetBSD__
82#include <sys/disklabel.h>
83#endif
84
85#include "zpool_util.h"
86
87#define BACKUP_SLICE "s2"
88
89/*
90 * For any given vdev specification, we can have multiple errors. The
91 * vdev_error() function keeps track of whether we have seen an error yet, and
92 * prints out a header if its the first error we've seen.
93 */
94boolean_t error_seen;
95boolean_t is_force;
96
97/*PRINTFLIKE1*/
98static void
99vdev_error(const char *fmt, ...)
100{
101 va_list ap;
102
103 if (!error_seen) {
104 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("invalid vdev specification\n"));
105 if (!is_force)
106 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("use '-f' to override "
107 "the following errors:\n"));
108 else
109 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("the following errors "
110 "must be manually repaired:\n"));
111 error_seen = B_TRUE;
112 }
113
114 va_start(ap, fmt);
115 (void) vfprintf(stderr, fmt, ap);
116 va_end(ap);
117}
118
119#ifdef illumos
120static void
121libdiskmgt_error(int error)
122{
123 /*
124 * ENXIO/ENODEV is a valid error message if the device doesn't live in
125 * /dev/dsk. Don't bother printing an error message in this case.
126 */
127 if (error == ENXIO || error == ENODEV)
128 return;
129
130 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("warning: device in use checking "
131 "failed: %s\n"), strerror(error));
132}
133
134/*
135 * Validate a device, passing the bulk of the work off to libdiskmgt.
136 */
137static int
138check_slice(const char *path, int force, boolean_t wholedisk, boolean_t isspare)
139{
140 char *msg;
141 int error = 0;
142 dm_who_type_t who;
143
144 if (force)
145 who = DM_WHO_ZPOOL_FORCE;
146 else if (isspare)
147 who = DM_WHO_ZPOOL_SPARE;
148 else
149 who = DM_WHO_ZPOOL;
150
151 if (dm_inuse((char *)path, &msg, who, &error) || error) {
152 if (error != 0) {
153 libdiskmgt_error(error);
154 return (0);
155 } else {
156 vdev_error("%s", msg);
157 free(msg);
158 return (-1);
159 }
160 }
161
162 /*
163 * If we're given a whole disk, ignore overlapping slices since we're
164 * about to label it anyway.
165 */
166 error = 0;
167 if (!wholedisk && !force &&
168 (dm_isoverlapping((char *)path, &msg, &error) || error)) {
169 if (error == 0) {
170 /* dm_isoverlapping returned -1 */
171 vdev_error(gettext("%s overlaps with %s\n"), path, msg);
172 free(msg);
173 return (-1);
174 } else if (error != ENODEV) {
175 /* libdiskmgt's devcache only handles physical drives */
176 libdiskmgt_error(error);
177 return (0);
178 }
179 }
180
181 return (0);
182}
183
184
185/*
186 * Validate a whole disk. Iterate over all slices on the disk and make sure
187 * that none is in use by calling check_slice().
188 */
189static int
190check_disk(const char *name, dm_descriptor_t disk, int force, int isspare)
191{
192 dm_descriptor_t *drive, *media, *slice;
193 int err = 0;
194 int i;
195 int ret;
196
197 /*
198 * Get the drive associated with this disk. This should never fail,
199 * because we already have an alias handle open for the device.
200 */
201 if ((drive = dm_get_associated_descriptors(disk, DM_DRIVE,
202 &err)) == NULL || *drive == NULL) {
203 if (err)
204 libdiskmgt_error(err);
205 return (0);
206 }
207
208 if ((media = dm_get_associated_descriptors(*drive, DM_MEDIA,
209 &err)) == NULL) {
210 dm_free_descriptors(drive);
211 if (err)
212 libdiskmgt_error(err);
213 return (0);
214 }
215
216 dm_free_descriptors(drive);
217
218 /*
219 * It is possible that the user has specified a removable media drive,
220 * and the media is not present.
221 */
222 if (*media == NULL) {
223 dm_free_descriptors(media);
224 vdev_error(gettext("'%s' has no media in drive\n"), name);
225 return (-1);
226 }
227
228 if ((slice = dm_get_associated_descriptors(*media, DM_SLICE,
229 &err)) == NULL) {
230 dm_free_descriptors(media);
231 if (err)
232 libdiskmgt_error(err);
233 return (0);
234 }
235
236 dm_free_descriptors(media);
237
238 ret = 0;
239
240 /*
241 * Iterate over all slices and report any errors. We don't care about
242 * overlapping slices because we are using the whole disk.
243 */
244 for (i = 0; slice[i] != NULL; i++) {
245 char *name = dm_get_name(slice[i], &err);
246
247 if (check_slice(name, force, B_TRUE, isspare) != 0)
248 ret = -1;
249
250 dm_free_name(name);
251 }
252
253 dm_free_descriptors(slice);
254 return (ret);
255}
256
257/*
258 * Validate a device.
259 */
260static int
261check_device(const char *path, boolean_t force, boolean_t isspare)
262{
263 dm_descriptor_t desc;
264 int err;
265 char *dev;
266
267 /*
268 * For whole disks, libdiskmgt does not include the leading dev path.
269 */
270 dev = strrchr(path, '/');
271 assert(dev != NULL);
272 dev++;
273 if ((desc = dm_get_descriptor_by_name(DM_ALIAS, dev, &err)) != NULL) {
274 err = check_disk(path, desc, force, isspare);
275 dm_free_descriptor(desc);
276 return (err);
277 }
278
279 return (check_slice(path, force, B_FALSE, isspare));
280}
281#endif /* illumos */
282
283/*
284 * Check that a file is valid. All we can do in this case is check that it's
285 * not in use by another pool, and not in use by swap.
286 */
287static int
288check_file(const char *file, boolean_t force, boolean_t isspare)
289{
290 char *name;
291 int fd;
292 int ret = 0;
293 int err;
294 pool_state_t state;
295 boolean_t inuse;
296
297#ifdef illumos
298 if (dm_inuse_swap(file, &err)) {
299 if (err)
300 libdiskmgt_error(err);
301 else
302 vdev_error(gettext("%s is currently used by swap. "
303 "Please see swap(1M).\n"), file);
304 return (-1);
305 }
306#endif
307
308 if ((fd = open(file, O_RDONLY)) < 0)
309 return (0);
310
311 if (zpool_in_use(g_zfs, fd, &state, &name, &inuse) == 0 && inuse) {
312 const char *desc;
313
314 switch (state) {
315 case POOL_STATE_ACTIVE:
316 desc = gettext("active");
317 break;
318
319 case POOL_STATE_EXPORTED:
320 desc = gettext("exported");
321 break;
322
323 case POOL_STATE_POTENTIALLY_ACTIVE:
324 desc = gettext("potentially active");
325 break;
326
327 default:
328 desc = gettext("unknown");
329 break;
330 }
331
332 /*
333 * Allow hot spares to be shared between pools.
334 */
335 if (state == POOL_STATE_SPARE && isspare)
336 return (0);
337
338 if (state == POOL_STATE_ACTIVE ||
339 state == POOL_STATE_SPARE || !force) {
340 switch (state) {
341 case POOL_STATE_SPARE:
342 vdev_error(gettext("%s is reserved as a hot "
343 "spare for pool %s\n"), file, name);
344 break;
345 default:
346 vdev_error(gettext("%s is part of %s pool "
347 "'%s'\n"), file, desc, name);
348 break;
349 }
350 ret = -1;
351 }
352
353 free(name);
354 }
355
356 (void) close(fd);
357 return (ret);
358}
359
360static int
361check_device(const char *name, boolean_t force, boolean_t isspare)
362{
363 char path[MAXPATHLEN];
364
365 if (strncmp(name, _PATH_DEV, sizeof(_PATH_DEV) - 1) != 0)
366 snprintf(path, sizeof(path), "%s%s", _PATH_DEV, name);
367 else
368 strlcpy(path, name, sizeof(path));
369
370 return (check_file(path, force, isspare));
371}
372
373/*
374 * By "whole disk" we mean an entire physical disk (something we can
375 * label, toggle the write cache on, etc.) as opposed to the full
376 * capacity of a pseudo-device such as lofi or did. We act as if we
377 * are labeling the disk, which should be a pretty good test of whether
378 * it's a viable device or not. Returns B_TRUE if it is and B_FALSE if
379 * it isn't.
380 */
381static boolean_t
382is_whole_disk(const char *arg)
383{
384#ifdef illumos
385 struct dk_gpt *label;
386 int fd;
387 char path[MAXPATHLEN];
388
389 (void) snprintf(path, sizeof (path), "%s%s%s",
390 ZFS_RDISK_ROOT, strrchr(arg, '/'), BACKUP_SLICE);
391 if ((fd = open(path, O_RDWR | O_NDELAY)) < 0)
392 return (B_FALSE);
393 if (efi_alloc_and_init(fd, EFI_NUMPAR, &label) != 0) {
394 (void) close(fd);
395 return (B_FALSE);
396 }
397 efi_free(label);
398 (void) close(fd);
399 return (B_TRUE);
400#endif
401#ifdef __FreeBSD__
402 int fd;
403
404 fd = g_open(arg, 0);
405 if (fd >= 0) {
406 g_close(fd);
407 return (B_TRUE);
408 }
409 return (B_FALSE);
410#endif
411#ifdef __NetBSD__
412 struct disklabel dl;
413 int fd, rv;
414
415 if ((fd = open(arg, O_RDWR | O_NONBLOCK)) < 0)
416 return (B_FALSE);
417
418 rv = ioctl(fd, DIOCGDINFO, &dl);
419 close(fd);
420 return (rv == 0);
421#endif
422}
423
424/*
425 * Create a leaf vdev. Determine if this is a file or a device. If it's a
426 * device, fill in the device id to make a complete nvlist. Valid forms for a
427 * leaf vdev are:
428 *
429 * /dev/dsk/xxx Complete disk path
430 * /xxx Full path to file
431 * xxx Shorthand for /dev/dsk/xxx
432 */
433static nvlist_t *
434make_leaf_vdev(const char *arg, uint64_t is_log)
435{
436 char path[MAXPATHLEN];
437 struct stat64 statbuf;
438 nvlist_t *vdev = NULL;
439 char *type = NULL;
440 boolean_t wholedisk = B_FALSE;
441
442 /*
443 * Determine what type of vdev this is, and put the full path into
444 * 'path'. We detect whether this is a device of file afterwards by
445 * checking the st_mode of the file.
446 */
447 if (arg[0] == '/') {
448 /*
449 * Complete device or file path. Exact type is determined by
450 * examining the file descriptor afterwards.
451 */
452 wholedisk = is_whole_disk(arg);
453 if (!wholedisk && (stat64(arg, &statbuf) != 0)) {
454 (void) fprintf(stderr,
455 gettext("cannot open '%s': %s\n"),
456 arg, strerror(errno));
457 return (NULL);
458 }
459
460 (void) strlcpy(path, arg, sizeof (path));
461 } else {
462 /*
463 * This may be a short path for a device, or it could be total
464 * gibberish. Check to see if it's a known device in
465 * /dev/dsk/. As part of this check, see if we've been given a
466 * an entire disk (minus the slice number).
467 */
468 if (strncmp(arg, _PATH_DEV, sizeof(_PATH_DEV) - 1) == 0)
469 strlcpy(path, arg, sizeof (path));
470 else
471 snprintf(path, sizeof (path), "%s%s", _PATH_DEV, arg);
472 wholedisk = is_whole_disk(path);
473 if (!wholedisk && (stat64(path, &statbuf) != 0)) {
474 /*
475 * If we got ENOENT, then the user gave us
476 * gibberish, so try to direct them with a
477 * reasonable error message. Otherwise,
478 * regurgitate strerror() since it's the best we
479 * can do.
480 */
481 if (errno == ENOENT) {
482 (void) fprintf(stderr,
483 gettext("cannot open '%s': no such "
484 "GEOM provider\n"), arg);
485 (void) fprintf(stderr,
486 gettext("must be a full path or "
487 "shorthand device name\n"));
488 return (NULL);
489 } else {
490 (void) fprintf(stderr,
491 gettext("cannot open '%s': %s\n"),
492 path, strerror(errno));
493 return (NULL);
494 }
495 }
496 }
497
498#ifdef __FreeBSD__
499 if (S_ISCHR(statbuf.st_mode)) {
500 statbuf.st_mode &= ~S_IFCHR;
501 statbuf.st_mode |= S_IFBLK;
502 wholedisk = B_FALSE;
503 }
504#endif
505
506 /*
507 * Determine whether this is a device or a file.
508 */
509 if (wholedisk || S_ISBLK(statbuf.st_mode)) {
510 type = VDEV_TYPE_DISK;
511 } else if (S_ISREG(statbuf.st_mode)) {
512 type = VDEV_TYPE_FILE;
513 } else {
514 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("cannot use '%s': must be a "
515 "GEOM provider or regular file\n"), path);
516 return (NULL);
517 }
518
519 /*
520 * Finally, we have the complete device or file, and we know that it is
521 * acceptable to use. Construct the nvlist to describe this vdev. All
522 * vdevs have a 'path' element, and devices also have a 'devid' element.
523 */
524 verify(nvlist_alloc(&vdev, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, 0) == 0);
525 verify(nvlist_add_string(vdev, ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, path) == 0);
526 verify(nvlist_add_string(vdev, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE, type) == 0);
527 verify(nvlist_add_uint64(vdev, ZPOOL_CONFIG_IS_LOG, is_log) == 0);
528 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_DISK) == 0)
529 verify(nvlist_add_uint64(vdev, ZPOOL_CONFIG_WHOLE_DISK,
530 (uint64_t)wholedisk) == 0);
531
532#ifdef have_devid
533 /*
534 * For a whole disk, defer getting its devid until after labeling it.
535 */
536 if (S_ISBLK(statbuf.st_mode) && !wholedisk) {
537 /*
538 * Get the devid for the device.
539 */
540 int fd;
541 ddi_devid_t devid;
542 char *minor = NULL, *devid_str = NULL;
543
544 if ((fd = open(path, O_RDONLY)) < 0) {
545 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("cannot open '%s': "
546 "%s\n"), path, strerror(errno));
547 nvlist_free(vdev);
548 return (NULL);
549 }
550
551 if (devid_get(fd, &devid) == 0) {
552 if (devid_get_minor_name(fd, &minor) == 0 &&
553 (devid_str = devid_str_encode(devid, minor)) !=
554 NULL) {
555 verify(nvlist_add_string(vdev,
556 ZPOOL_CONFIG_DEVID, devid_str) == 0);
557 }
558 if (devid_str != NULL)
559 devid_str_free(devid_str);
560 if (minor != NULL)
561 devid_str_free(minor);
562 devid_free(devid);
563 }
564
565 (void) close(fd);
566 }
567#endif
568
569 return (vdev);
570}
571
572/*
573 * Go through and verify the replication level of the pool is consistent.
574 * Performs the following checks:
575 *
576 * For the new spec, verifies that devices in mirrors and raidz are the
577 * same size.
578 *
579 * If the current configuration already has inconsistent replication
580 * levels, ignore any other potential problems in the new spec.
581 *
582 * Otherwise, make sure that the current spec (if there is one) and the new
583 * spec have consistent replication levels.
584 */
585typedef struct replication_level {
586 char *zprl_type;
587 uint64_t zprl_children;
588 uint64_t zprl_parity;
589} replication_level_t;
590
591#define ZPOOL_FUZZ (16 * 1024 * 1024)
592
593/*
594 * Given a list of toplevel vdevs, return the current replication level. If
595 * the config is inconsistent, then NULL is returned. If 'fatal' is set, then
596 * an error message will be displayed for each self-inconsistent vdev.
597 */
598static replication_level_t *
599get_replication(nvlist_t *nvroot, boolean_t fatal)
600{
601 nvlist_t **top;
602 uint_t t, toplevels;
603 nvlist_t **child;
604 uint_t c, children;
605 nvlist_t *nv;
606 char *type;
607 replication_level_t lastrep = {0};
608 replication_level_t rep;
609 replication_level_t *ret;
610 boolean_t dontreport;
611
612 ret = safe_malloc(sizeof (replication_level_t));
613
614 verify(nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
615 &top, &toplevels) == 0);
616
617 for (t = 0; t < toplevels; t++) {
618 uint64_t is_log = B_FALSE;
619
620 nv = top[t];
621
622 /*
623 * For separate logs we ignore the top level vdev replication
624 * constraints.
625 */
626 (void) nvlist_lookup_uint64(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_IS_LOG, &is_log);
627 if (is_log)
628 continue;
629
630 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE,
631 &type) == 0);
632 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
633 &child, &children) != 0) {
634 /*
635 * This is a 'file' or 'disk' vdev.
636 */
637 rep.zprl_type = type;
638 rep.zprl_children = 1;
639 rep.zprl_parity = 0;
640 } else {
641 uint64_t vdev_size;
642
643 /*
644 * This is a mirror or RAID-Z vdev. Go through and make
645 * sure the contents are all the same (files vs. disks),
646 * keeping track of the number of elements in the
647 * process.
648 *
649 * We also check that the size of each vdev (if it can
650 * be determined) is the same.
651 */
652 rep.zprl_type = type;
653 rep.zprl_children = 0;
654
655 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_RAIDZ) == 0) {
656 verify(nvlist_lookup_uint64(nv,
657 ZPOOL_CONFIG_NPARITY,
658 &rep.zprl_parity) == 0);
659 assert(rep.zprl_parity != 0);
660 } else {
661 rep.zprl_parity = 0;
662 }
663
664 /*
665 * The 'dontreport' variable indicates that we've
666 * already reported an error for this spec, so don't
667 * bother doing it again.
668 */
669 type = NULL;
670 dontreport = 0;
671 vdev_size = -1ULL;
672 for (c = 0; c < children; c++) {
673 boolean_t is_replacing, is_spare;
674 nvlist_t *cnv = child[c];
675 char *path;
676 struct stat64 statbuf;
677 uint64_t size = -1ULL;
678 char *childtype;
679 int fd, err;
680
681 rep.zprl_children++;
682
683 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(cnv,
684 ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE, &childtype) == 0);
685
686 /*
687 * If this is a replacing or spare vdev, then
688 * get the real first child of the vdev.
689 */
690 is_replacing = strcmp(childtype,
691 VDEV_TYPE_REPLACING) == 0;
692 is_spare = strcmp(childtype,
693 VDEV_TYPE_SPARE) == 0;
694 if (is_replacing || is_spare) {
695 nvlist_t **rchild;
696 uint_t rchildren;
697
698 verify(nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(cnv,
699 ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN, &rchild,
700 &rchildren) == 0);
701 assert((is_replacing && rchildren == 2)
702 || (is_spare && rchildren >= 2));
703 cnv = rchild[0];
704
705 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(cnv,
706 ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE,
707 &childtype) == 0);
708 }
709
710 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(cnv,
711 ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, &path) == 0);
712
713 /*
714 * If we have a raidz/mirror that combines disks
715 * with files, report it as an error.
716 */
717 if (!dontreport && type != NULL &&
718 strcmp(type, childtype) != 0) {
719 if (ret != NULL)
720 free(ret);
721 ret = NULL;
722 if (fatal)
723 vdev_error(gettext(
724 "mismatched replication "
725 "level: %s contains both "
726 "files and devices\n"),
727 rep.zprl_type);
728 else
729 return (NULL);
730 dontreport = B_TRUE;
731 }
732
733 /*
734 * According to stat(2), the value of 'st_size'
735 * is undefined for block devices and character
736 * devices. But there is no effective way to
737 * determine the real size in userland.
738 *
739 * Instead, we'll take advantage of an
740 * implementation detail of spec_size(). If the
741 * device is currently open, then we (should)
742 * return a valid size.
743 *
744 * If we still don't get a valid size (indicated
745 * by a size of 0 or MAXOFFSET_T), then ignore
746 * this device altogether.
747 */
748 if ((fd = open(path, O_RDONLY)) >= 0) {
749 err = fstat64(fd, &statbuf);
750 (void) close(fd);
751 } else {
752 err = stat64(path, &statbuf);
753 }
754
755 if (err != 0 ||
756 statbuf.st_size == 0 ||
757 statbuf.st_size == MAXOFFSET_T)
758 continue;
759
760 size = statbuf.st_size;
761
762 /*
763 * Also make sure that devices and
764 * slices have a consistent size. If
765 * they differ by a significant amount
766 * (~16MB) then report an error.
767 */
768 if (!dontreport &&
769 (vdev_size != -1ULL &&
770 (labs(size - vdev_size) >
771 ZPOOL_FUZZ))) {
772 if (ret != NULL)
773 free(ret);
774 ret = NULL;
775 if (fatal)
776 vdev_error(gettext(
777 "%s contains devices of "
778 "different sizes\n"),
779 rep.zprl_type);
780 else
781 return (NULL);
782 dontreport = B_TRUE;
783 }
784
785 type = childtype;
786 vdev_size = size;
787 }
788 }
789
790 /*
791 * At this point, we have the replication of the last toplevel
792 * vdev in 'rep'. Compare it to 'lastrep' to see if its
793 * different.
794 */
795 if (lastrep.zprl_type != NULL) {
796 if (strcmp(lastrep.zprl_type, rep.zprl_type) != 0) {
797 if (ret != NULL)
798 free(ret);
799 ret = NULL;
800 if (fatal)
801 vdev_error(gettext(
802 "mismatched replication level: "
803 "both %s and %s vdevs are "
804 "present\n"),
805 lastrep.zprl_type, rep.zprl_type);
806 else
807 return (NULL);
808 } else if (lastrep.zprl_parity != rep.zprl_parity) {
809 if (ret)
810 free(ret);
811 ret = NULL;
812 if (fatal)
813 vdev_error(gettext(
814 "mismatched replication level: "
815 "both %llu and %llu device parity "
816 "%s vdevs are present\n"),
817 lastrep.zprl_parity,
818 rep.zprl_parity,
819 rep.zprl_type);
820 else
821 return (NULL);
822 } else if (lastrep.zprl_children != rep.zprl_children) {
823 if (ret)
824 free(ret);
825 ret = NULL;
826 if (fatal)
827 vdev_error(gettext(
828 "mismatched replication level: "
829 "both %llu-way and %llu-way %s "
830 "vdevs are present\n"),
831 lastrep.zprl_children,
832 rep.zprl_children,
833 rep.zprl_type);
834 else
835 return (NULL);
836 }
837 }
838 lastrep = rep;
839 }
840
841 if (ret != NULL)
842 *ret = rep;
843
844 return (ret);
845}
846
847/*
848 * Check the replication level of the vdev spec against the current pool. Calls
849 * get_replication() to make sure the new spec is self-consistent. If the pool
850 * has a consistent replication level, then we ignore any errors. Otherwise,
851 * report any difference between the two.
852 */
853static int
854check_replication(nvlist_t *config, nvlist_t *newroot)
855{
856 nvlist_t **child;
857 uint_t children;
858 replication_level_t *current = NULL, *new;
859 int ret;
860
861 /*
862 * If we have a current pool configuration, check to see if it's
863 * self-consistent. If not, simply return success.
864 */
865 if (config != NULL) {
866 nvlist_t *nvroot;
867
868 verify(nvlist_lookup_nvlist(config, ZPOOL_CONFIG_VDEV_TREE,
869 &nvroot) == 0);
870 if ((current = get_replication(nvroot, B_FALSE)) == NULL)
871 return (0);
872 }
873 /*
874 * for spares there may be no children, and therefore no
875 * replication level to check
876 */
877 if ((nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(newroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
878 &child, &children) != 0) || (children == 0)) {
879 free(current);
880 return (0);
881 }
882
883 /*
884 * If all we have is logs then there's no replication level to check.
885 */
886 if (num_logs(newroot) == children) {
887 free(current);
888 return (0);
889 }
890
891 /*
892 * Get the replication level of the new vdev spec, reporting any
893 * inconsistencies found.
894 */
895 if ((new = get_replication(newroot, B_TRUE)) == NULL) {
896 free(current);
897 return (-1);
898 }
899
900 /*
901 * Check to see if the new vdev spec matches the replication level of
902 * the current pool.
903 */
904 ret = 0;
905 if (current != NULL) {
906 if (strcmp(current->zprl_type, new->zprl_type) != 0) {
907 vdev_error(gettext(
908 "mismatched replication level: pool uses %s "
909 "and new vdev is %s\n"),
910 current->zprl_type, new->zprl_type);
911 ret = -1;
912 } else if (current->zprl_parity != new->zprl_parity) {
913 vdev_error(gettext(
914 "mismatched replication level: pool uses %llu "
915 "device parity and new vdev uses %llu\n"),
916 current->zprl_parity, new->zprl_parity);
917 ret = -1;
918 } else if (current->zprl_children != new->zprl_children) {
919 vdev_error(gettext(
920 "mismatched replication level: pool uses %llu-way "
921 "%s and new vdev uses %llu-way %s\n"),
922 current->zprl_children, current->zprl_type,
923 new->zprl_children, new->zprl_type);
924 ret = -1;
925 }
926 }
927
928 free(new);
929 if (current != NULL)
930 free(current);
931
932 return (ret);
933}
934
935#ifdef illumos
936/*
937 * Go through and find any whole disks in the vdev specification, labelling them
938 * as appropriate. When constructing the vdev spec, we were unable to open this
939 * device in order to provide a devid. Now that we have labelled the disk and
940 * know that slice 0 is valid, we can construct the devid now.
941 *
942 * If the disk was already labeled with an EFI label, we will have gotten the
943 * devid already (because we were able to open the whole disk). Otherwise, we
944 * need to get the devid after we label the disk.
945 */
946static int
947make_disks(zpool_handle_t *zhp, nvlist_t *nv)
948{
949 nvlist_t **child;
950 uint_t c, children;
951 char *type, *path, *diskname;
952 char buf[MAXPATHLEN];
953 uint64_t wholedisk;
954 int fd;
955 int ret;
956 ddi_devid_t devid;
957 char *minor = NULL, *devid_str = NULL;
958
959 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE, &type) == 0);
960
961 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
962 &child, &children) != 0) {
963
964 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_DISK) != 0)
965 return (0);
966
967 /*
968 * We have a disk device. Get the path to the device
969 * and see if it's a whole disk by appending the backup
970 * slice and stat()ing the device.
971 */
972 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, &path) == 0);
973 if (nvlist_lookup_uint64(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_WHOLE_DISK,
974 &wholedisk) != 0 || !wholedisk)
975 return (0);
976
977 diskname = strrchr(path, '/');
978 assert(diskname != NULL);
979 diskname++;
980 if (zpool_label_disk(g_zfs, zhp, diskname) == -1)
981 return (-1);
982
983 /*
984 * Fill in the devid, now that we've labeled the disk.
985 */
986 (void) snprintf(buf, sizeof (buf), "%ss0", path);
987 if ((fd = open(buf, O_RDONLY)) < 0) {
988 (void) fprintf(stderr,
989 gettext("cannot open '%s': %s\n"),
990 buf, strerror(errno));
991 return (-1);
992 }
993
994 if (devid_get(fd, &devid) == 0) {
995 if (devid_get_minor_name(fd, &minor) == 0 &&
996 (devid_str = devid_str_encode(devid, minor)) !=
997 NULL) {
998 verify(nvlist_add_string(nv,
999 ZPOOL_CONFIG_DEVID, devid_str) == 0);
1000 }
1001 if (devid_str != NULL)
1002 devid_str_free(devid_str);
1003 if (minor != NULL)
1004 devid_str_free(minor);
1005 devid_free(devid);
1006 }
1007
1008 /*
1009 * Update the path to refer to the 's0' slice. The presence of
1010 * the 'whole_disk' field indicates to the CLI that we should
1011 * chop off the slice number when displaying the device in
1012 * future output.
1013 */
1014 verify(nvlist_add_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, buf) == 0);
1015
1016 (void) close(fd);
1017
1018 return (0);
1019 }
1020
1021 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1022 if ((ret = make_disks(zhp, child[c])) != 0)
1023 return (ret);
1024
1025 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_SPARES,
1026 &child, &children) == 0)
1027 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1028 if ((ret = make_disks(zhp, child[c])) != 0)
1029 return (ret);
1030
1031 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_L2CACHE,
1032 &child, &children) == 0)
1033 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1034 if ((ret = make_disks(zhp, child[c])) != 0)
1035 return (ret);
1036
1037 return (0);
1038}
1039#endif /* illumos */
1040
1041/*
1042 * Determine if the given path is a hot spare within the given configuration.
1043 */
1044static boolean_t
1045is_spare(nvlist_t *config, const char *path)
1046{
1047 int fd;
1048 pool_state_t state;
1049 char *name = NULL;
1050 nvlist_t *label;
1051 uint64_t guid, spareguid;
1052 nvlist_t *nvroot;
1053 nvlist_t **spares;
1054 uint_t i, nspares;
1055 boolean_t inuse;
1056
1057 if ((fd = open(path, O_RDONLY)) < 0)
1058 return (B_FALSE);
1059
1060 if (zpool_in_use(g_zfs, fd, &state, &name, &inuse) != 0 ||
1061 !inuse ||
1062 state != POOL_STATE_SPARE ||
1063 zpool_read_label(fd, &label) != 0) {
1064 free(name);
1065 (void) close(fd);
1066 return (B_FALSE);
1067 }
1068 free(name);
1069 (void) close(fd);
1070
1071 verify(nvlist_lookup_uint64(label, ZPOOL_CONFIG_GUID, &guid) == 0);
1072 nvlist_free(label);
1073
1074 verify(nvlist_lookup_nvlist(config, ZPOOL_CONFIG_VDEV_TREE,
1075 &nvroot) == 0);
1076 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_SPARES,
1077 &spares, &nspares) == 0) {
1078 for (i = 0; i < nspares; i++) {
1079 verify(nvlist_lookup_uint64(spares[i],
1080 ZPOOL_CONFIG_GUID, &spareguid) == 0);
1081 if (spareguid == guid)
1082 return (B_TRUE);
1083 }
1084 }
1085
1086 return (B_FALSE);
1087}
1088
1089/*
1090 * Go through and find any devices that are in use. We rely on libdiskmgt for
1091 * the majority of this task.
1092 */
1093static boolean_t
1094is_device_in_use(nvlist_t *config, nvlist_t *nv, boolean_t force,
1095 boolean_t replacing, boolean_t isspare)
1096{
1097 nvlist_t **child;
1098 uint_t c, children;
1099 char *type, *path;
1100 int ret = 0;
1101 char buf[MAXPATHLEN];
1102 uint64_t wholedisk;
1103 boolean_t anyinuse = B_FALSE;
1104
1105 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE, &type) == 0);
1106
1107 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
1108 &child, &children) != 0) {
1109
1110 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, &path) == 0);
1111
1112 /*
1113 * As a generic check, we look to see if this is a replace of a
1114 * hot spare within the same pool. If so, we allow it
1115 * regardless of what libdiskmgt or zpool_in_use() says.
1116 */
1117 if (replacing) {
1118#ifdef illumos
1119 if (nvlist_lookup_uint64(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_WHOLE_DISK,
1120 &wholedisk) == 0 && wholedisk)
1121 (void) snprintf(buf, sizeof (buf), "%ss0",
1122 path);
1123 else
1124#endif
1125 (void) strlcpy(buf, path, sizeof (buf));
1126
1127 if (is_spare(config, buf))
1128 return (B_FALSE);
1129 }
1130
1131 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_DISK) == 0)
1132 ret = check_device(path, force, isspare);
1133 else if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_FILE) == 0)
1134 ret = check_file(path, force, isspare);
1135
1136 return (ret != 0);
1137 }
1138
1139 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1140 if (is_device_in_use(config, child[c], force, replacing,
1141 B_FALSE))
1142 anyinuse = B_TRUE;
1143
1144 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_SPARES,
1145 &child, &children) == 0)
1146 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1147 if (is_device_in_use(config, child[c], force, replacing,
1148 B_TRUE))
1149 anyinuse = B_TRUE;
1150
1151 if (nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_L2CACHE,
1152 &child, &children) == 0)
1153 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1154 if (is_device_in_use(config, child[c], force, replacing,
1155 B_FALSE))
1156 anyinuse = B_TRUE;
1157
1158 return (anyinuse);
1159}
1160
1161static const char *
1162is_grouping(const char *type, int *mindev, int *maxdev)
1163{
1164 if (strncmp(type, "raidz", 5) == 0) {
1165 const char *p = type + 5;
1166 char *end;
1167 long nparity;
1168
1169 if (*p == '\0') {
1170 nparity = 1;
1171 } else if (*p == '0') {
1172 return (NULL); /* no zero prefixes allowed */
1173 } else {
1174 errno = 0;
1175 nparity = strtol(p, &end, 10);
1176 if (errno != 0 || nparity < 1 || nparity >= 255 ||
1177 *end != '\0')
1178 return (NULL);
1179 }
1180
1181 if (mindev != NULL)
1182 *mindev = nparity + 1;
1183 if (maxdev != NULL)
1184 *maxdev = 255;
1185 return (VDEV_TYPE_RAIDZ);
1186 }
1187
1188 if (maxdev != NULL)
1189 *maxdev = INT_MAX;
1190
1191 if (strcmp(type, "mirror") == 0) {
1192 if (mindev != NULL)
1193 *mindev = 2;
1194 return (VDEV_TYPE_MIRROR);
1195 }
1196
1197 if (strcmp(type, "spare") == 0) {
1198 if (mindev != NULL)
1199 *mindev = 1;
1200 return (VDEV_TYPE_SPARE);
1201 }
1202
1203 if (strcmp(type, "log") == 0) {
1204 if (mindev != NULL)
1205 *mindev = 1;
1206 return (VDEV_TYPE_LOG);
1207 }
1208
1209 if (strcmp(type, "cache") == 0) {
1210 if (mindev != NULL)
1211 *mindev = 1;
1212 return (VDEV_TYPE_L2CACHE);
1213 }
1214
1215 return (NULL);
1216}
1217
1218/*
1219 * Construct a syntactically valid vdev specification,
1220 * and ensure that all devices and files exist and can be opened.
1221 * Note: we don't bother freeing anything in the error paths
1222 * because the program is just going to exit anyway.
1223 */
1224nvlist_t *
1225construct_spec(int argc, char **argv)
1226{
1227 nvlist_t *nvroot, *nv, **top, **spares, **l2cache;
1228 int t, toplevels, mindev, maxdev, nspares, nlogs, nl2cache;
1229 const char *type;
1230 uint64_t is_log;
1231 boolean_t seen_logs;
1232
1233 top = NULL;
1234 toplevels = 0;
1235 spares = NULL;
1236 l2cache = NULL;
1237 nspares = 0;
1238 nlogs = 0;
1239 nl2cache = 0;
1240 is_log = B_FALSE;
1241 seen_logs = B_FALSE;
1242
1243 while (argc > 0) {
1244 nv = NULL;
1245
1246 /*
1247 * If it's a mirror or raidz, the subsequent arguments are
1248 * its leaves -- until we encounter the next mirror or raidz.
1249 */
1250 if ((type = is_grouping(argv[0], &mindev, &maxdev)) != NULL) {
1251 nvlist_t **child = NULL;
1252 int c, children = 0;
1253
1254 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_SPARE) == 0) {
1255 if (spares != NULL) {
1256 (void) fprintf(stderr,
1257 gettext("invalid vdev "
1258 "specification: 'spare' can be "
1259 "specified only once\n"));
1260 return (NULL);
1261 }
1262 is_log = B_FALSE;
1263 }
1264
1265 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_LOG) == 0) {
1266 if (seen_logs) {
1267 (void) fprintf(stderr,
1268 gettext("invalid vdev "
1269 "specification: 'log' can be "
1270 "specified only once\n"));
1271 return (NULL);
1272 }
1273 seen_logs = B_TRUE;
1274 is_log = B_TRUE;
1275 argc--;
1276 argv++;
1277 /*
1278 * A log is not a real grouping device.
1279 * We just set is_log and continue.
1280 */
1281 continue;
1282 }
1283
1284 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_L2CACHE) == 0) {
1285 if (l2cache != NULL) {
1286 (void) fprintf(stderr,
1287 gettext("invalid vdev "
1288 "specification: 'cache' can be "
1289 "specified only once\n"));
1290 return (NULL);
1291 }
1292 is_log = B_FALSE;
1293 }
1294
1295 if (is_log) {
1296 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_MIRROR) != 0) {
1297 (void) fprintf(stderr,
1298 gettext("invalid vdev "
1299 "specification: unsupported 'log' "
1300 "device: %s\n"), type);
1301 return (NULL);
1302 }
1303 nlogs++;
1304 }
1305
1306 for (c = 1; c < argc; c++) {
1307 if (is_grouping(argv[c], NULL, NULL) != NULL)
1308 break;
1309 children++;
1310 child = realloc(child,
1311 children * sizeof (nvlist_t *));
1312 if (child == NULL)
1313 zpool_no_memory();
1314 if ((nv = make_leaf_vdev(argv[c], B_FALSE))
1315 == NULL)
1316 return (NULL);
1317 child[children - 1] = nv;
1318 }
1319
1320 if (children < mindev) {
1321 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("invalid vdev "
1322 "specification: %s requires at least %d "
1323 "devices\n"), argv[0], mindev);
1324 return (NULL);
1325 }
1326
1327 if (children > maxdev) {
1328 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("invalid vdev "
1329 "specification: %s supports no more than "
1330 "%d devices\n"), argv[0], maxdev);
1331 return (NULL);
1332 }
1333
1334 argc -= c;
1335 argv += c;
1336
1337 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_SPARE) == 0) {
1338 spares = child;
1339 nspares = children;
1340 continue;
1341 } else if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_L2CACHE) == 0) {
1342 l2cache = child;
1343 nl2cache = children;
1344 continue;
1345 } else {
1346 verify(nvlist_alloc(&nv, NV_UNIQUE_NAME,
1347 0) == 0);
1348 verify(nvlist_add_string(nv, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE,
1349 type) == 0);
1350 verify(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
1351 ZPOOL_CONFIG_IS_LOG, is_log) == 0);
1352 if (strcmp(type, VDEV_TYPE_RAIDZ) == 0) {
1353 verify(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
1354 ZPOOL_CONFIG_NPARITY,
1355 mindev - 1) == 0);
1356 }
1357 verify(nvlist_add_nvlist_array(nv,
1358 ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN, child,
1359 children) == 0);
1360
1361 for (c = 0; c < children; c++)
1362 nvlist_free(child[c]);
1363 free(child);
1364 }
1365 } else {
1366 /*
1367 * We have a device. Pass off to make_leaf_vdev() to
1368 * construct the appropriate nvlist describing the vdev.
1369 */
1370 if ((nv = make_leaf_vdev(argv[0], is_log)) == NULL)
1371 return (NULL);
1372 if (is_log)
1373 nlogs++;
1374 argc--;
1375 argv++;
1376 }
1377
1378 toplevels++;
1379 top = realloc(top, toplevels * sizeof (nvlist_t *));
1380 if (top == NULL)
1381 zpool_no_memory();
1382 top[toplevels - 1] = nv;
1383 }
1384
1385 if (toplevels == 0 && nspares == 0 && nl2cache == 0) {
1386 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("invalid vdev "
1387 "specification: at least one toplevel vdev must be "
1388 "specified\n"));
1389 return (NULL);
1390 }
1391
1392 if (seen_logs && nlogs == 0) {
1393 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("invalid vdev specification: "
1394 "log requires at least 1 device\n"));
1395 return (NULL);
1396 }
1397
1398 /*
1399 * Finally, create nvroot and add all top-level vdevs to it.
1400 */
1401 verify(nvlist_alloc(&nvroot, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, 0) == 0);
1402 verify(nvlist_add_string(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_TYPE,
1403 VDEV_TYPE_ROOT) == 0);
1404 verify(nvlist_add_nvlist_array(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN,
1405 top, toplevels) == 0);
1406 if (nspares != 0)
1407 verify(nvlist_add_nvlist_array(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_SPARES,
1408 spares, nspares) == 0);
1409 if (nl2cache != 0)
1410 verify(nvlist_add_nvlist_array(nvroot, ZPOOL_CONFIG_L2CACHE,
1411 l2cache, nl2cache) == 0);
1412
1413 for (t = 0; t < toplevels; t++)
1414 nvlist_free(top[t]);
1415 for (t = 0; t < nspares; t++)
1416 nvlist_free(spares[t]);
1417 for (t = 0; t < nl2cache; t++)
1418 nvlist_free(l2cache[t]);
1419 if (spares)
1420 free(spares);
1421 if (l2cache)
1422 free(l2cache);
1423 free(top);
1424
1425 return (nvroot);
1426}
1427
1428nvlist_t *
1429split_mirror_vdev(zpool_handle_t *zhp, char *newname, nvlist_t *props,
1430 splitflags_t flags, int argc, char **argv)
1431{
1432 nvlist_t *newroot = NULL, **child;
1433 uint_t c, children;
1434
1435 if (argc > 0) {
1436 if ((newroot = construct_spec(argc, argv)) == NULL) {
1437 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("Unable to build a "
1438 "pool from the specified devices\n"));
1439 return (NULL);
1440 }
1441
1442#ifdef illumos
1443 if (!flags.dryrun && make_disks(zhp, newroot) != 0) {
1444 nvlist_free(newroot);
1445 return (NULL);
1446 }
1447#endif
1448
1449 /* avoid any tricks in the spec */
1450 verify(nvlist_lookup_nvlist_array(newroot,
1451 ZPOOL_CONFIG_CHILDREN, &child, &children) == 0);
1452 for (c = 0; c < children; c++) {
1453 char *path;
1454 const char *type;
1455 int min, max;
1456
1457 verify(nvlist_lookup_string(child[c],
1458 ZPOOL_CONFIG_PATH, &path) == 0);
1459 if ((type = is_grouping(path, &min, &max)) != NULL) {
1460 (void) fprintf(stderr, gettext("Cannot use "
1461 "'%s' as a device for splitting\n"), type);
1462 nvlist_free(newroot);
1463 return (NULL);
1464 }
1465 }
1466 }
1467
1468 if (zpool_vdev_split(zhp, newname, &newroot, props, flags) != 0) {
1469 nvlist_free(newroot);
1470 return (NULL);
1471 }
1472
1473 return (newroot);
1474}
1475
1476/*
1477 * Get and validate the contents of the given vdev specification. This ensures
1478 * that the nvlist returned is well-formed, that all the devices exist, and that
1479 * they are not currently in use by any other known consumer. The 'poolconfig'
1480 * parameter is the current configuration of the pool when adding devices
1481 * existing pool, and is used to perform additional checks, such as changing the
1482 * replication level of the pool. It can be 'NULL' to indicate that this is a
1483 * new pool. The 'force' flag controls whether devices should be forcefully
1484 * added, even if they appear in use.
1485 */
1486nvlist_t *
1487make_root_vdev(zpool_handle_t *zhp, int force, int check_rep,
1488 boolean_t replacing, boolean_t dryrun, int argc, char **argv)
1489{
1490 nvlist_t *newroot;
1491 nvlist_t *poolconfig = NULL;
1492 is_force = force;
1493
1494 /*
1495 * Construct the vdev specification. If this is successful, we know
1496 * that we have a valid specification, and that all devices can be
1497 * opened.
1498 */
1499 if ((newroot = construct_spec(argc, argv)) == NULL)
1500 return (NULL);
1501
1502 if (zhp && ((poolconfig = zpool_get_config(zhp, NULL)) == NULL))
1503 return (NULL);
1504
1505 /*
1506 * Validate each device to make sure that its not shared with another
1507 * subsystem. We do this even if 'force' is set, because there are some
1508 * uses (such as a dedicated dump device) that even '-f' cannot
1509 * override.
1510 */
1511 if (is_device_in_use(poolconfig, newroot, force, replacing, B_FALSE)) {
1512 nvlist_free(newroot);
1513 return (NULL);
1514 }
1515
1516 /*
1517 * Check the replication level of the given vdevs and report any errors
1518 * found. We include the existing pool spec, if any, as we need to
1519 * catch changes against the existing replication level.
1520 */
1521 if (check_rep && check_replication(poolconfig, newroot) != 0) {
1522 nvlist_free(newroot);
1523 return (NULL);
1524 }
1525
1526#ifdef illumos
1527 /*
1528 * Run through the vdev specification and label any whole disks found.
1529 */
1530 if (!dryrun && make_disks(zhp, newroot) != 0) {
1531 nvlist_free(newroot);
1532 return (NULL);
1533 }
1534#endif
1535
1536 return (newroot);
1537}
1538
